data.title: Mike Miller leaves after coaching Houston basketball to state title in only season; Kurt Couvion promoted
authors: Chris Van Tuyl, The Commercial Appeal
data.meta_description: Kurt Couvion takes over as Houston boys basketball coach after former NBA star Mike Miller leads the Mustangs to a TSSAA state title one season ago.
data.text:
The Houston boys’ basketball team will enter the 2021-22 season without coach Mike Miller on the sideline.

Miller, a former NBA player and Memphis Tigers assistant coach under Penny Hardaway, guided the Mustangs to a 21-3 record and the TSSAA Class AAA state championship in his only season with the team.

Houston athletic director Chad Becker confirmed to The Commercial Appeal that Miller is no longer coaching at the school. Kurt Couvion, who was already an assistant coach, will be the coach this season, Becker said.

Houston eliminated Clarksville and Oak Ridge, before defeating Cane Ridge, 62-43, for the title on March 20 at MTSU. Miller’s one season on the Mustang bench allowed him the chance to coach his son, Mason, who is now at Creighton.

Miller, a two-time NBA champion, played 17 years professionally, including two different stints with the Memphis Grizzlies.

The Mustangs begin the season Monday with a Hall of Fame game at Beech.
